contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist | name = Fernanda Abreu | image = Fernanda Abreu, 2009.jpg | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Fernanda Sampaio de Lacerda Abreu | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|9|8|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Rio de Janeiro (city)|Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil]] | death_date = | death_place = | origin = | instrument = [[Singing]] | genre = [[Brazilian funk]], disco, pop | occupation = | years_active = | label = | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = | past_members = | notable_instruments = }} '''Fernanda Abreu''' (born September 8, 1961) is a Brazilian singer. ==Biography== Fernanda was born and raised in a middle-class family of the [[Rio de Janeiro#South Zone|South Zone]], of Rio de Janeiro. Her first notable public appearance was the backing vocal of the band [[Blitz (Brazilian band)|Blitz]] until 1986. After that, in 1990, she started a solo career singing [[Brazilian funk|funk]], [[disco music|disco]] and [[dance music]], achieving great success in her native country. In 1989, she met [[Herbert Vianna]], and with his help and encouragment formed a funk band. Her first solo album, ''SLA Radical Dance Disco Club'' (1990), was produced by Herbert Vianna and [[Fábio Fonseca]] and had a hit with ''A Noite'', composed with Luiz Stein and [//pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laufer Laufer]. Her second album, ''SLA2/Be Sample'' (1992), was one of the earliest Brazilian pop records to extensively employ the sampler, and had success with ''Rio 40 Graus'',<ref>Yúdice, George. "The Funkification of Rio." In Microphone Fiends, 193-220. London: Routledge, 1994.</ref> composed with [[Fausto Fawcett]] and [//pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laufer Laufer], portraying [[Rio de Janeiro]] climate, people and lifestyle. Since then, Abreu has been considered the first lady of Brazilian [[funk]].<ref>http://fernandaabreu.uol.com.br/prehome.htm</ref> In 2006, she released ''Ao Vivo MTV'', the first [[DVD]] of her career, which includes many of her hit songs.<ref>http://www.sites-faction.mus.br/Biografias/Fernanda%20Abreu.htm</ref> Abreu is married to the musician and designer Luiz Stein and has 2 daughters, Alice and Sofia. ==Discography== *''Sla Radical Dance Disco Club'' (1990) *''Sla 2 Be Sample'' (1992) *''Da Lata'' (1995) *''[[Raio X (álbum)|Raio X - Revista e Ampliada]]'' (1997) *''Entidade Urbana'' (2000) *''Na Paz'' (2004) *''[[MTV Ao Vivo]]'' (2006) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Fernanda Abreu}} * [http://fernandaabreu.uol.com.br/ Official website] {{Authority control|VIAF=66662836}} {{Persondata | NAME =Abreu, Fernanda | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Singer | DATE OF BIRTH =September 8, 1961 | PLACE OF BIRTH =Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abreu, Fernanda}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Brazilian female singers]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Portuguese descent]] [[Category:People from Rio de Janeiro (city)]] [[Category:Funk carioca musicians]] {{Brazil-singer-stub}}
